question: Which one of the following statements is true?
option1: Union Territories are not represented in the Rajya Sabha
option2: Jurisdiction regarding election disputes rests with the Chief Election Commissioner
option3: Jnaneshwar â€” Bengali The Speaker continues in his post even after the state council is dissolved till a new speaker is elected by the succeeding state council
option4: According to the Indian Constitution Parliament consists of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha only
answer: Jurisdiction regarding election disputes rests with the Chief Election Commissioner
explanation: If there is a dispute in the elections of the President and the Vice President then it will be solved by the Supreme Court. And if there is a dispute in the elections of Rajya Sabha, Lok Sabha and vidhan Sabha then it will be solved by the election commission.
